title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Youth Justice (Transfer of
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Youth Justice (Transfer of 

Departmental Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2020. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 14 October 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited youth justice (transfer departmental administration ministerial functions) order 2020 (2) order come operation 14 october 2020

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise,
text_raw:
2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise, 
performance or execution of any functions transferred by Article 3 are 
transferred to the Department of Justice and Equality. 

(2) References to the Department of Children and Youth Affairs contained 
in any Act or any instrument made under such Act and relating to any 
administration and business transferred by paragraph (1) shall, on and after the 
commencement of this Order, be construed as references to the Department of 
Justice and Equality.
text_norm: 2 (1) administration business connection exercise performance execution function transferred article 3 transferred department justice equality (2) reference department child youth affair contained act instrument made act relating administration business transferred paragraph (1) shall commencement order construed reference department justice equality

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 3. (1) The functions vested in the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs
text_raw:
3. (1) The functions vested in the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs 

in relation to - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the administration of the scheme commonly known as the Bail 
Supervision Scheme, 

the project commonly known as the Greentown Project, and 

the project commonly known as the Research Evidence into 
Practice Project, 

are transferred to the Minister for Justice and Equality. 

(2) References to the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs contained in 
any Act or instrument made under such Act and relating to any functions 
transferred by this Article shall, on and after the commencement of this Order, 
be construed as references to the Minister for Justice and Equality.
text_norm: 3 (1) function vested minister child youth affair relation - (a) (b) (c) administration scheme commonly known bail supervision scheme project commonly known greentown project project commonly known research evidence practice project transferred minister justice equality (2) reference minister child youth affair contained act instrument made act relating function transferred article shall commencement order construed reference minister justice equality

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal
text_raw:
4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal 
proceedings are pending to which the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs 
is a party and the proceedings have reference to functions transferred by this 
Order to the Minister for Justice and Equality, the name of the Minister for 
Justice and Equality shall, in so far as the proceedings relate to any function 
transferred by this Order, be substituted in the proceedings for that of the 
Minister for Children and Youth Affairs or added in the proceedings, as may be 
appropriate, and the proceedings shall not abate by reason of such substitution. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [435] 3

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or
text_raw:
5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or 
under the authority of the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs may, in so far 
as it relates to functions transferred by this Order to the Minister for Justice and 
Equality, be carried on or completed on or after such commencement by the 
Minister for Justice and Equality.
text_norm: 5 anything commenced commencement order authority minister child youth affair may far relates function transferred order minister justice equality carried completed commencement minister justice equality

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in
text_raw:
6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in 
the performance of a function transferred by this Order, if and in so far as it was 
operative immediately before the commencement of this Order, has effect on and 
after such commencement as if it had been granted or made by the Minister for 
Justice and Equality.
text_norm: 6 every document (including certificate licence) granted made performance function transferred order far operative immediately commencement order effect commencement granted made minister justice equality

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 7. References to the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs contained in
text_raw:
7. References to the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs contained in 
the memorandum and articles of association of any company and relating to any 
function transferred by this Order shall, on and after the commencement of this 
Order, be construed as references to the Minister for Justice and Equality.
text_norm: 7 reference minister child youth affair contained memorandum article association company relating function transferred order shall commencement order construed reference minister justice equality

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the
text_raw:
8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the 
commencement of this Order by the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs in 
connection with the functions transferred by this Order are transferred on the 
commencement to the Minister for Justice and Equality and, accordingly, 
without any further conveyance, transfer or assignment- 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

that property, both real and personal, vests in the Minister for 
Justice and Equality, 

those rights are rights of the Minister for Justice and Equality, and 

those liabilities are liabilities of the Minister for Justice and 
Equality. 

(2) All moneys, stocks, shares and securities transferred to the Minister for 
Justice and Equality by this Article which, on the commencement of this Order, 
are standing in the name of the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs shall, on 
the request of the Minister for Justice and Equality, be transferred into the name 
of the Minister for Justice and Equality. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [435] 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

13 October, 2020. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach.
